answers.answer: It really depends on the person as to how induction goes. My induction was horrible. I had thirty six hours of excruciating piggybacking contractions, two epidurals that didn't work, and ended in an emergency c section because I stopped progressing and LO heartrate kept dropping and mine was going through the roof. Some women will say theirs went great, and a lot will say theirs ended in sections. It really just depends. I personally will never allow my doctors to induce me again with any future children. Especially after I read an article about "informed refusal of induction"
Actually the article is called "saying no to induction"

I was induced with my first my water broke and I only dialated 1 cm in. 6 hours and the next 13 hours was horrible my epideral didn't work whatsoever I threw up twice from the pain and progressed too quickly to try for the drugs again. At the end I was having trouble catching my breath I have asthma that flares up when getting an extreme workout they had to give me an oxygen mask cuz my daughters heart rate kept dropping from not enough oxygen getting to her and because I wanted the epideral I hate to wear a blood pressure thing.on my arm and just so happened that every contraction I had it'd take my blood pressure at the same time so I'd be contracting.and my arm would be.going numb cuz it was so tight and it made everything that much worse... Hopefully never have to be.induced again most horrible experience.ever..

Induction does turn out to be a different experience for everyone... but mine went "okay" considering... I was induced 10 days late with my daughter. They used cervidil to ripen my cervix I think I had to leave it in for 12 hours or so... but my contractions started while that was inside preparing my cervix. It took a long time for me to dilate to 4 cm, about 18 hours or so. And then I got the epidural as soon as they would let me because the contractions were very painful and very close together ever since they started. I seemed to progress better with the dilation after I got it. They broke my water and baby started stressing a bit so they put sterile water back inside of me and put me on oxygen etc. When it came time to push, I pushed for an hour with no luck and took a 30 minute rest and then pushed another hour with no luck so they gave me a choice to try a vacuum assisted birth or go ahead with a csection.. I chose to try the vacuum first and that worked luckily! Altogether from the start of contractions I was in labor for 28 hours. I'm now pregnant with my second 11 days until my due date and I'm praying I won't have to go through another induction! Good luck!

My induction went ok i guess just a very long process...i wasnt dialated effaced or anything i went in on a friday night the started the induction meds that one lasted 12 hours and only dialated me to a one.so they had to redo the induction thing finally after friday and sat being induced they broke my water sunday morning thats when the conttactions really started so about 1pm that sunday i got my epidural and i went to sleep and at 3pm i woke up to my baby having a low heart rate it was time for her to come out i only pushed for maybe 3 mins and ahe was out....i was 8 days overdue with her
Have you considered natural ways to go into labour?
Have you considered natural ways to go into labour?

I got induced and honestly for me it was not bad at all. I was 2.5 cm dialated and 100% effaced so they jus started pitocin at 2 pm. Didn't feel anything but little cramps so they broke my water at 7 pm than instantly contractions were bad every 2 mins. Got epidural at 945 and by 1245 it was time to push and had baby Sophia at 118 am. So start to finish was only 11 hours. Good luck hun ur almost done!!!

My induction was okay....I had preeclampsia but once they started giving me pitocin I progressed somewhat quickly. I was in labor for 14 hours and didn't get an epidural. Of course it was very very painful, but I expected it to be. I was also given pitocin with my 2nd child and I was only in labor 7 hours with no epidural and it was a really good experience for me....but of course every pregnancy and labor is different :-)

question: So my due date was Sept. 24th but had no luck of delivery, haven't dialated or anything so right now i'm scheduled for Oct 5th (hopefully something sooner comes open) but my question is what should I truly expect ? I don't like sugar coats or beating around the bush, so please keep it "real" lol thanks in advance :)
title: FTM being induced Oct 5th (11 Days Overdue) and I won't honest answers :)
